hints.content: The total mass of the cheese slices is $\greenD{27}$ grams.

We can find the mass of each cheese slice by dividing the total number of grams $(\greenD{27}\text{ g})$ by the number of cheese slices $(\maroonD3)$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 27. The bottom rectangle is divided into 3 equal-sized parts. Each part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the bottom rectangle is labeled 3 equal groups. !

hints.content: $\greenD{27}\text { grams}\div\maroonD3\text { cheese slices}= \blueD9 \text { grams per slice}$
One cheese slice has a mass of $9$ grams.

question.content:
All of the cheese slices at Chester's Cheesy Cafe have the same mass.

Chester finds that the total mass of $3$ cheese slices is $27$ grams.

**What is the mass of one of the cheese slices?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] grams
